p: Next, we examined the impact of repeated vaccination on current season VE against any influenza and each influenza type/subtype for the 2010/11 to 2015/16 seasons combined. We did this taking into account incrementally longer vaccination history durations (i.e. one, five, and 10 previous influenza seasons). Since influenza vaccination data in Ontario are more accurate among those aged ≥ 65 years [ 22], we restricted the analysis examining 5-year vaccination history to patients aged ≥ 70 years in the current season to ensure they were ≥ 65 years for all previous seasons. Similarly, we restricted the analysis examining 10-year vaccination history to patients aged ≥ 75 years in the current season. Patients had to be eligible for health insurance in Ontario during the previous seasons investigated.
